contextId.information: The abstract noun "wickedness" can be translated as a verb. It is spoken of as if it were an object that could be found in a container. This can be translated in active form. AT: "he does what is evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The abstract noun "forgiveness" can be translated as a verb. AT: "ask you to forgive them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The abstract noun "sight" can be expressed with the verb "see." Looking at something is a metaphor for protecting it. AT: "I will put it where I no longer have to see it" or "I will get rid of it so I no longer have to protect it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: I will cast it out of my sight

contextId.information: The abstract noun "favor" can be expressed as a verb. AT: "Plead that Yahweh your God may favor me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Plead for the favor of Yahweh your God

contextId.information: The abstract noun "advice" can be translated as a verb. AT: "coming to ask you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: coming to seek advice from you

contextId.information: The abstract noun "sins" can be expressed with the verb "sin." AT: "because Jeroboam sinned and led Israel to sin in the same ways" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: for the sins of Jeroboam which he committed and by which he led Israel to sin

contextId.information: The abstract noun "anger" can be expressed with the adjective "angry." AT: "so as to make Yahweh very angry" or "that made God very angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: so as to provoke him to anger
